intro: Xanthoxalis wrightii, commonly known as Wright's golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and basal leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Xanthoxalis wrightii is a perennial herb that produces achenes as its fruit, which are dispersed by wind.
